channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report X-2024081506
item.description:
Report X-2024081506

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-27T06:25:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-16
  • City: Cheektowaga
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered at the BUFR location. The fiberboard box contained a plastic bottle packaged in a plastic bag with a absorbent pad. The cap was loose on the bottle and it spilled all of the contents. It was placed into a steel salvage package and will be disposed of as hazardous material.

item.title: Report I-2024080083
item.description:
Report I-2024080083

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-16
  • City: Long Island City
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DHL EXPRESS (USA), INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 08/16/2024 hidden dangerous goods were discovered during the shipment inspection process at the DHL Express UC facility, located at 12-12 33rd Avenue, Long Island City, NY 11106. Transportation by road has been confirmed. Shipment also contains UN3481 Lithium ion batteries contained in equipment Class 9 Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Packaging Type: Case Material of Construction: Plastic Package Capacity: 168 g Amount in Package: 168 g Number in Shipment: 1 t Number Failed: 1

item.title: Report I-2024080046
item.description:
Report I-2024080046

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: BUFFALO
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: After service had been completed, Keith Miller(U265254) began to pick up trash. While going down the aisle, passenger gave Keith a cup for the trash with the vape inside of the cup, and a little bit of water it looked like He did not realize at the time what was in the cup After Purser informed the captain she came up behind Keith and informed him they need to grab the TCB because she found out someone's vape was beginning to go rouge Realizing it was in the trash they went to go retrieve it, crew stated it was Ieaking a little of the vapors and described it as pineapple scented They followed SOP and placed the TCB in the aft most lavatory(this instance they placed it in aft right Iav)
